text.0: this stream sarasvatī with fostering current comes forth our sure defence our fort of iron.
text.1: as on a car the flood flows on surpassing in majesty and might all other waters.
text.2: pure in her course from mountains to the ocean alone of streams sarasvatī hath listened.
text.3: thinking of wealth and the great world of creatures she poured for nahuṣa her milk and fatness.
text.4: friendly to man he grew among the women a strong young steer amid the holy ladies.
text.5: he gives the fleet steed to our wealthy princes and decks their bodies for success in battle.
text.6: may this sarasvatī be pleased and listen at this our sacrifice auspicious lady.
text.7: when we with reverence on our knees implore her closeknit to wealth most kind to those she loveth.
text.8: these offerings have ye made with adoration say this sarasvatī and accept our praises.
text.9: and placing us under thy dear protection may we approach thee as a tree for shelter.
text.10: for thee o blest sarasvatī vasiṣṭha hath here unbarred the doors d sacred order.
text.11: wax bright one and give strength to him who lauds thee preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
